page.title: 15Calderstones Hospital,Lancs.
page.content: The building of{'accomodation for {imbeciles and epileptics'}on land near Whalley began in 1907.In 1914, when almost complete,the building was put to use as a{military}hospital for wounded soldiers,known then as{Queen {Mary's Military Hospital.} In 1921 it reopened for its original purpose and has remained a hospital for the{mentally handicapped}ever since.Known now as{Calderstones,}the grounds cover an area of{70 acres. For many years the role of the hospital was largely{custodial}- the emphasis has now turned to{training the handicapped to lead as normal a life as possible and to become {integrated}with the rest of the {community. Currently there are{967}residents living in units of 18-20, looked after by a staff of over{1200.
